column2: stacynolan81, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am agymnast, and a soccer pleyer. I have been very, very athletic my whole life. Recently I had been having severe neck pain, and I have a very painful buldging disk. I don't by any means take this medication on a daily or regular basis, but when the pain is to a point that it is just unbearable, and that's is even putting it very lightly. I must say in combination with my chiropractor, and a variation of hot and cold tretments to my neck; when I do need to use this medication, it definately does what it is suppose to do, and brings much needed relief! Thankyou Sincerely, Jen!

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month
Future Pharmacist
column9: Oh dear!  Lorcet is not prophoxyphene at all!  Lorcet is a combination of hydrocodone and acetaminophen.  Darvocet however is a combination of propoxyphene and acetaminophen but has been pulled from the market due to cardiac issues.  WebMD, get your information straight!(Student Pharmacist)

column9: i have been taking this medication for several yrs. now due to an injury at work that has left me with severe lower back pain(slipped,bulging discs and pinched nerve) i have found this medication is most effective if i take it before the pain gets too severe and take it along with soma for the muscle spasms.they tell you if the medication makes you feel sick to your stomach to eat with it but i recommend lying or sitting down till it passes(if you have this problem)because eating with this medication will cause it to lose some of its effectiveness.

column2: Broken_Ankel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication works fine if you take it with food.
